Plot the multi-trait stability index

Source: R/plot.mtsi.R
plot.mtsi.Rd

Makes a radar plot showing the multitrait stability index proposed by Olivoto et al. (2019)

# S3 method for mtsi
plot(x, SI = 15, radar = TRUE, arrange.label = FALSE,
  size.point = 2.5, col.sel = "red", col.nonsel = "black",
  size.text = 10, ...)

Arguments

x

An object of class mtsi
SI

An integer [0-100]. The selection intensity in percentage of the total number of genotypes.
radar

Logical argument. If true (default) a radar plot is generated after using coord_polar().
arrange.label

Logical argument. If TRUE, the labels are arranged to avoid text overlapping. This becomes useful when the number of genotypes is large, say, more than 30.
size.point

The size of the point in graphic. Defaults to 2.5.
col.sel

The colour for selected genotypes.
col.nonsel

The colour for nonselected genotypes.
size.text

The size for the text in the plot. Defaults to 10.
...

Other arguments to be passed from ggplot2::theme().

Value

An object of class gg, ggplot.

References

Olivoto, T., A.D.C. L\'ucio, J.A.G. da silva, B.G. Sari, and M.I. Diel. 2019. Mean performance and stability in multi-environment trials II: Selection based on multiple traits. Agron. J. (in press).

Examples

library(metan)
mtsi_model <- waasb(data_ge,
                   env = ENV,
                   gen = GEN,
                   rep = REP,
                   resp = c(GY, HM))
#> Evaluating variable GY 50 % 
#> Evaluating variable HM 100 % 
#> Done!

mtsi_index <- mtsi(mtsi_model)
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Principal Component Analysis
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>     Eigenvalues Variance (%) Cum. variance (%)
#> PC1   1.6566277     82.83139          82.83139
#> PC2   0.3433723     17.16861         100.00000
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Factor Analysis - factorial loadings after rotation-
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          FA1 Communality Uniquenesses
#> GY 0.9101175   0.8283139    0.1716861
#> HM 0.9101175   0.8283139    0.1716861
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Comunalit Mean: 0.8283139 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Multitrait stability index
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>     G3     G1     G6     G8     G4     G2     G9     G5     G7    G10 
#> 0.0000 0.2303 0.4846 1.0066 1.2954 1.6022 1.8318 1.8374 1.8450 3.4178 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selection differential for the  waasb index
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>    Factor        Xo        Xs         SD    SDperc
#> GY    FA1 0.2504736 0.1165028 -0.1339708 -53.48700
#> HM    FA1 0.6141648 0.3732404 -0.2409244 -39.22798
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Mean of selection differential
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          Xo          Xs          SD      SDperc 
#>   0.4323192   0.2448716  -0.1874476 -46.3574863 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selection differential for the mean of the variables
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>    Factor        Xo       Xs         SD    SDperc
#> GY    FA1  2.674242  2.77951  0.1052684  3.936384
#> HM    FA1 48.088286 47.34179 -0.7465000 -1.552353
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selected genotypes
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> G3 G1
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
plot(mtsi_index)

# Alternatively using the pipe operator %>%
mtsi_index2 <- data_ge %>%
               waasb(ENV, GEN, REP, c(GY, HM)) %>%
               mtsi()
#> Evaluating variable GY 50 % 
#> Evaluating variable HM 100 % 
#> Done!
#> 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Principal Component Analysis
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>     Eigenvalues Variance (%) Cum. variance (%)
#> PC1   1.6566277     82.83139          82.83139
#> PC2   0.3433723     17.16861         100.00000
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Factor Analysis - factorial loadings after rotation-
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          FA1 Communality Uniquenesses
#> GY 0.9101175   0.8283139    0.1716861
#> HM 0.9101175   0.8283139    0.1716861
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Comunalit Mean: 0.8283139 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Multitrait stability index
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>     G3     G1     G6     G8     G4     G2     G9     G5     G7    G10 
#> 0.0000 0.2303 0.4846 1.0066 1.2954 1.6022 1.8318 1.8374 1.8450 3.4178 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selection differential for the  waasb index
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>    Factor        Xo        Xs         SD    SDperc
#> GY    FA1 0.2504736 0.1165028 -0.1339708 -53.48700
#> HM    FA1 0.6141648 0.3732404 -0.2409244 -39.22798
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Mean of selection differential
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>          Xo          Xs          SD      SDperc 
#>   0.4323192   0.2448716  -0.1874476 -46.3574863 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selection differential for the mean of the variables
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#>    Factor        Xo       Xs         SD    SDperc
#> GY    FA1  2.674242  2.77951  0.1052684  3.936384
#> HM    FA1 48.088286 47.34179 -0.7465000 -1.552353
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Selected genotypes
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> G3 G1
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
plot(mtsi_index2)
